title: Solar prominences
creator_credit: McMath-Hulbert Observatory and Audio Visual Education Center, University of Michigan
brief_description: Presents observations, during the period of 140 hours, at a specially designed solar telescope recording the activities of gaseous clouds near the sun’s surface. The types of prominences included are quiescent, spot, cap, quasi-eruptive, and loop or fountain.
creator_credit_for_label: McMath-Hulbert Observatory and Audio Visual Education Center, University of Michigan
